textPlain: looking at the examples, it looks more like a Rails alternative?
Looks cool, good luck with the launch!A well designed login component to go along with this might do wonders for the adoption.
Does this have a live layer? Would be a miss if not
Rails for Ruby is similar with the simplicity and structure (same idea here for TypeScript), but Modelence is more cloud-first focused and less of a pure framework.

Thanks! We do have the auth components here - https://github.com/modelence/modelence/tree/main/packages/au...Probably need to add screenshots also, but our own platform at https://cloud.modelence.com uses these built-in auth UI from Modelence and a lot of other things it is bootstrapped with.

Do you mean real-time data / live sync? It is actually the next thing we're going to release, so yes - it is definitely a core part. We took our inspiration from https://meteor.com and it had a big emphasis on live data which we're going to support in a more scalable way.
